headline: American Water Charitable Foundation Continues National Partnership with American Red Cross
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., May 28, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., announced today that it has again donated $250,000 to the American Red Cross, continuing its membership in the Disaster Responder Program. Proactively funding disaster relief helps ensure the Red Cross is better prepared to meet the needs of those affected by disasters, both

content.title: American Water Charitable Foundation Continues National Partnership with American Red Cross
content.summary: CAMDEN, N.J., May 28, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., announced today that it has again donated $250,000 to the American Red Cross, continuing its membership in the Disaster Responder Program. Proactively funding disaster relief helps ensure the Red Cross is better prepared to meet the needs of those affected by disasters, both

thumbnail.caption: American Water Charitable Foundation President Carrie Williams and American Water President and CEO John Griffith present a $250,000 check to the American Red Cross.
